DataElement.preferredName: Radiosurgery Total Brain Volume Receive Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numerical quantity measured, or assigned, or computed, constituting the total volume of the brain receiving radiation surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A type of external radiation therapy that uses special equipment to position the patient and precisely give a single large dose of radiation to a tumor. It is used to treat brain tumors and other brain disorders that cannot be treated by regular surgery. It is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container._To take, accept, or get something offered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A radiation therapy technique that delivers radiation directly to the tumor while sparing the healthy tissue. Also called radiation surgery and stereotactic external beam irradiation.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to treat cancer cells that use high energy beams.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed with a max of 6 characters and 2 decimals, units of measure not specified.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
